tool.name: SAGA.grid_visualisation.8
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEM False output_data_SHADE $output_data_SHADE output_data_OPENNESS $output_data_OPENNESS output_data_SLOPE $output_data_SLOPE output_data_CONTOURS $output_data_CONTOURS name SAGA.grid_visualisation.8 DEM $DEM METHOD $METHOD RADIUS $RADIUS CONTOUR_LINES $CONTOUR_LINES EQUIDISTANCE $EQUIDISTANCE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_SHADE $OutputSection_SHADE.outputType_SHADE transmissionMode_SHADE $OutputSection_SHADE.transmissionMode_SHADE outputType_OPENNESS $OutputSection_OPENNESS.outputType_OPENNESS transmissionMode_OPENNESS $OutputSection_OPENNESS.transmissionMode_OPENNESS outputType_SLOPE $OutputSection_SLOPE.outputType_SLOPE transmissionMode_SLOPE $OutputSection_SLOPE.transmissionMode_SLOPE outputType_CONTOURS $OutputSection_CONTOURS.outputType_CONTOURS transmissionMode_CONTOURS $OutputSection_CONTOURS.transmissionMode_CONTOURS

param.name: DEM
param.label: DEM
param.help: Digital elevation model. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, x-ogc-envi, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: METHOD
param.label: Method
param.help: Choose the map type to generate.

param.name: RADIUS
param.label: Radial Limit
param.help: Radial search limit for openness calculation.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_SHADE
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_OPENNESS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_OPENNESS
param.label: Openness
param.help: The difference of positive and negative openness.

section.name: OutputSection_SLOPE
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_CONTOURS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: This tool allows one to create different terrain visualisations from an elevation dataset:<br/><br/>* Topography: a simple map with an analytical hillshading of the terrain<br/><br/>* Morphology: a map which visualizes the terrain by combining positive and negative openness (Yokoyama et al. 2002) with terrain slope in a single map. In contrast to conventional shading methods this has the advantage of being independent from the direction of the light source.<br/><br/>References:<br/>Yokoyama, R. / Shirasawa, M. / Pike, R.J. (2002): Visualizing topography by openness: A new application of image processing to digital elevation models. Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing, Vol.68, pp.251-266. <a target="_blank" href="http://info.asprs.org/publications/pers/2002journal/march/2002_mar_257-265.pdf">online at ASPRS</a>.<br/><br/>
